errors.memo_missing: You do not have control of the memo key for this account. In order to use a memo, please set the account memo key to a key you control using the Permissions page.
errors.not_found: Le compte %(name)s n'existe pas, veuillez vérifier le nom

account.history_error: Failed to download the account history, please try again
account.in_open: This is the amount of %(asset)s you have in open orders.
account.in_open_value: This is the estimated value of the %(asset)s you have in open orders.
account.intro_text_2: The DEX is inherently decentralized, enabling you to trade the BitShares core token (BTS) and a range of trustless price-stable, market-pegged assets such as bitUSD, bitCNY, bitBTC, bitGold and more. These assets can all be traded with zero counter-party risk, putting you in total control of your funds.
account.intro_text_3: The DEX also enables creation of user-issued assets (UIAs), which can be traded against any other UIAs or trustless assets on the platform. One well-known issuer on The DEX is OpenLedger, offering a host of assets including BTC, ETH, STEEM, DASH, LTC, DOGE, and many more
account.intro_text_4: This gives cryptocurrency traders a unique blend of traditional and decentralized trading, all in a familiar exchange interface. Happy trading!

member.network_percentage: Pourcentage de frais pour le reseau
member.referral_text: Give this to link to people you want to refer to BitShares

account.name: Nom du compte

name_input.premium_name_faucet: This is a premium name which is not supported by this faucet. Please enter a regular name containing least one dash, a number or no vowels.
name_input.premium_name_warning: This is a premium name which is more expensive than a name containing a dash (-) or a number.

optional.formatter: Optionally, {restore_link} or create an account using the {restore_form}.

perm.memo_warning: WARNING: If you replace the memo key you will be unable to read old memos when logging in with your password, and unless you import the new memo private key into your old wallet that wallet will be unable to decode new memos
perm.password_model_1: If you want to be able to login from anywhere using only your password, you can use this page to add new keys to your permissions. If you also want to remove the original keys, you can do so in the active/owner permissions tabs.
perm.warning1: Active permissions weights total of %(weights_total)s should be equal or exceed threshold of %(threshold)s
perm.warning2: Owner permissions weights total of %(weights_total)s should be equal or exceed threshold of %(threshold)s

account.total_estimate: This is the estimated value of all your assets, including any hidden assets, open orders, debt and collateral. The estimate is done using only live blockchain data and may not be perfectly accurate.

user_issued_assets.cer_warning_2: Make sure your core exchange rate is higher than the market price, otherwise people will buy your token from the market and drain your fee pool via implicit arbitrage. The core exchange rate should be updated regularly to reflect market pricing of your asset.
user_issued_assets.committee_fed_asset: Allow committee members to provide feeds
user_issued_assets.conflict_feed: Cannot allow witnesses and committee members to provide feeds simultaneously
user_issued_assets.error_invalid: That asset may not be used
user_issued_assets.error_precision: That asset does not have the same precision as %(asset)s
user_issued_assets.error_too_deep: May not create a bitasset backed by a bitasset backed by a bitasset
user_issued_assets.feed_not_allowed_1: Cannot set feed producers on a witness- or committee-fed asset
user_issued_assets.feed_not_allowed_2: Please disable the flags called 'Allow witnesses to provide feeds' and 'Allow committee members to provide feeds' in order to allow manual definition of feed producers
user_issued_assets.global_settle: Allow issuer to force a global settling
user_issued_assets.invalid_backing_asset_change: You can't change the backing asset of an asset that has a non-zero current supply
user_issued_assets.invalid_market_pair: Preferred market pairing can not be the same market
user_issued_assets.invalid_permissions_change: You can't enable a permission for an asset that has a non-zero current supply
user_issued_assets.max_positive: Max supply should be a positive number
user_issued_assets.maximum_force_settlement_volume: Max force settle volume (percent of total supply per hour)

user_issued_assets.override_authority: Issuer may transfer asset back to himself

user_issued_assets.precision_warning: Warning: The number of decimals may not be changed after creation
user_issued_assets.too_large: That max supply is too big, please choose a smaller number
user_issued_assets.too_many_feed: Number of feed producers exceeded the max allowed (%(max)s).
user_issued_assets.update_owner_text: The asset owner may change the owner to another account using this form:
user_issued_assets.visible: Hide asset from search and markets

vesting.explain: Vesting balances contain any fees earned through the referral program or from worker pay, for example. They have a certain vesting period and are continually unlocked during that vesting period until all of the balances are available

errors.below: Your collateral ratio is below %(mr)s which is not allowed.
errors.below_info: Your position is below the required maintenance collateral ratio! Increasing collateral ratio is allowed, debt can only be decreased.

errors.close: Your collateral ratio is close to %(mr)s which means this position is in danger of being margin called if the price drops.
errors.increased_debt_on_margin_call: You increased your debt, which is not allowed when updating a margin called position

notification.lower_than: The price of %(pair)s fell lower than %(expectedPrice)s and now is %(actualPrice)s

tooltip.chart_height: Define the height of the charts
tooltip.chart_reload: Changing this setting will reload the chart
tooltip.chart_tools: Shows/Hides the left and top toolbar, as well as the context menu. Tools are always hidden in tiny screen.
tooltip.chart_type: Switch between market depth and price charts, or disable charts
tooltip.chart_zoom: Allow chart zooming. Zooming is always disabled in tiny screen.
tooltip.decrease_chart_height: Decrease the height of the chart
tooltip.hide_function_buttons: Hide all buttons that can be managed within the personalize form
tooltip.increase_chart_height: Increase the height of the chart
tooltip.market_location: Which side to pin the vertical order book on. This will switch place with market panel
tooltip.order_book_grouping: Group orders which are close together by a defined percentage
tooltip.order_style: Use vertical order book to pin it to the side panel
tooltip.orderbook_auto_scroll: Auto scroll the order book to keep center as new orders come in. Disable to allow scrolling
tooltip.position_order_asset: Define the vertical order for the order form vs order book
tooltip.position_order_form: Define the horizontal order for the order form
tooltip.position_order_orders: Define the horizontal order for the order book
tooltip.reload: Changing this option will only affect after manually reloading
tooltip.reverse_order_book: Reverse order book to have buy orders on top
tooltip.single_colum_order_form: Enforce that Price, Quantity, Total, etc. are in one column (not floating)

exchange.settle_delay: This asset will settle in %(hours)s hours
exchange.settle_globally_settled_tooltip: This asset is globally settled. You can settle it instantly for the global settlement price (see exchange header or asset details)
exchange.settlement_hint: You are attempting to settle {long}. Here is a price break down of {market_link}:
exchange.worth_less_settlement_warning: Warning! You can get a better price by selling to {market_link}.

collateral.bid_text: Unfortunately, %(asset)s is in Global Settlement. During this time it is possible to bid on the collateral in the Settlement Fund and the debt it covers. When the total outstanding debt is covered by bids, and the additional collateral of each bid plus its share from the settlement fund is greater than the MCR, the asset is automatically revived and a margin position is created for each bid.
collateral.remove_bid: A bid can be removed by placing a zero collateral bid.

fee_pool.claim_pool_text: The asset owner may withdraw funds from the fee pool using this form:
fee_pool.claim_text: The asset issuer may claim any accumulated fees here.
fee_pool.fund_text: The fee pool is used to pay fees in %(core)s by converting the fee in %(asset)s to %(core)s. If the fee pool runs out of funds, fees may no longer be paid in %(asset)s and will default to %(core)s
fee_pool.pool_text:
The fee pool is used to pay fees in %(core)s by converting the fee in %(asset)s to %(core)s. If the fee pool runs out of funds, fees may no longer be paid in %(asset)s and will default to %(core)s.

The core exchange rate is the price at which %(asset)s are converted to %(core)s.
fee_pool.title: Fee Pool

asset.feed_producer_text: Approved feed producers may publish a new feed using the form below:

settlement.gs_description: Unfortunately, this asset is in Global Settlement. During this time there is no delay in asset force settlements, which will be covered by the settlement funds at the fixed settlement price.
settlement.gs_included_on_revival: Bids will be included on revival sorted by their bid price until the whole debt is covered (last bid might be covered partially). Included bids will be converted into margin positions and receive the residual collateral such that the position reaches MCR from the settlement fund. Not included bids will be reimbursed.
settlement.gs_place_bid: click here to place a bid
settlement.gs_revive: Asset will be revived automatically if auto revive price (bids included) is greater than feed price or all debt is force settled
settlement.max_settle_volume: Max. settlement volume each maintenance period
settlement.title: Settlement

asset.title: Actif

whitelist.enable_flag: The whitelist flag must be enabled in order to set whitelist authorities

committee_members.active: Total number of active committee members
committee_members.title: Délégués

proposals.authority_depth_warning: This proposal may not get approved because this permission exceeds the maximum authority depth.
proposals.children_authority_depth_warning: This proposal may not get approved because a permission exceeds the maximum authority depth.
proposals.title: Propositions

workers.create_text_1: In order to create your new worker, please fill in the form below. The worker will be created using your currently active account, which must already be a lifetime member.
workers.create_text_2: Consider carefully the parameters you choose as they can not be changed once you've published your worker.
workers.date_text: The start date should be at least a week into the future in order to allow people the time to discover, evaluate and vote for your worker.
workers.name_text: The name of your worker should be short and descriptive, something like this: 'Worker Purpose - Account Name'
workers.pay_text: The daily pay defines how much you want to be paid per day and is defined in BTS. The current best practice is to define a salary in USD/CNY, and commit to burning whatever surplus you receive as a result of the BTS price increasing. As long as your worker is active and has sufficient votes to be above the refund worker, you will receive this daily salary.
workers.title: Ouvriers
workers.url_text: You should supply a website, github document or google doc that describes in more detail the purpose of the worker and how you intend to use the worker pay.
workers.vesting_text: The vesting period defines the number of days that worker earnings will vest before being fully claimable.

footer.nosync: Your active node is out of sync

assets.bit: bit%(asset)s is a derivative that tracks the real value of %(backed)s. It is 100%% decentralized, trustless and backed by collateral held by the blockchain in a smart contract.
assets.bitcny: bitCNY can be deposited or withdrawn 1:1 to real Yuan using a gateway service such as Magic Wallet. For more info, see https://www.magicw.net/
assets.bridge: The %(asset)s asset is backed 1:1 by real %(backed)s and can be deposited or withdrawn using the gateway service provided by CryptoBridge.
assets.gdex: The %(asset)s asset is backed 1:1 by real %(backed)s and can be deposited or withdrawn using the gateway service provided by GDex.
assets.open: The %(asset)s asset is backed 1:1 by real %(backed)s and can be deposited or withdrawn using the gateway service provided by Openledger.
assets.rudex: The %(asset)s asset is backed 1:1 by real %(backed)s and can be deposited or withdrawn using the gateway service provided by Rudex.
assets.trade: The %(asset)s asset is backed 1:1 by real %(backed)s and can be deposited or withdrawn using the gateway service provided by Blocktrades.

migration.announcement_1: In an effort to provide enhanced security for the web-based wallet, we are migrating it, effective immediately to the address below. Please be sure to update any bookmarks you may have.
migration.text_2: Please backup your wallet now and restore the backup file to https://wallet.bitshares.org, which will be your new address for the web wallet. Thanks for your continued support.
migration.text_3: Please use https://wallet.bitshares.org from now on, your existing credentials will let you login there as well.
migration.title: Notice

deposit.bts_transfer_description: It's easy to receive BTS from anywhere. As long as BTS is sent to your account name it will show up in your wallet. This QR code also contains your account name.

An empty password will show an unencrypted QR code.

report.copyScreenshot: Right click in Image Preview -> Copy
report.explanatory_text_1: This report collects the last entries in the console log and takes a screenshot of the current view before the modal is opened. Click on either entry to see the details.
report.explanatory_text_2: Please report the issue you have found to GitHub:
report.explanatory_text_3: You can copy and paste (CTRL+V) the screenshot as well as the log entries directly into the issue content text area, pasting the screenshot also works in telegram chat.
report.explanatory_text_4: If your issue affects user security you might be eligible for a bounty. In that case do not report it publicly, but rather through:
report.title: Error report

settings.wallet_text: Control the details of your local wallet.

barter.action: Peer 1 (%(peer_left)s) offers to send %(assets_left)s to Peer 2 (%(peer_right)s) and receives %(assets_right)s in return.
barter.add_escrow_tooltip: Adds or removes an escrow to this barter. This escrow will have to approve the resulting proposal as well. The escrow can serve as a witness only, or also be the custodian of Peer 1's funds.
barter.balance_warning_line: wants to send a total of %(asset_amount)s %(asset_symbol)s, but only has %(asset_balance)s %(asset_symbol)s
barter.balance_warning_tooltip: %(peer)s does not have enough funds to execute the transfers when the proposal gets approved and executes. This is not an issue when creating the proposal, but the balances must match when executed
barter.description: Allows you to suggest an asset swap with another account, this happens outside the order book and can include an escrow.
barter.error_fill_in_escrow_name: Please fill in the account name of the escrow
barter.error_fill_in_peer_left_name: Please fill in the account name of Peer 1
barter.error_fill_in_peer_right_name: Please fill in the account name of Peer 2
barter.error_fill_in_valid_asset_amount: Please fill in valid amounts for the bartering assets
barter.error_same_name: Peer 1 and Peer 2 must be different accounts
barter.error_same_name_escrow: The escrow can not be Peer 1 or Peer 2
barter.escrow_as_custodian: An escrow (%(escrow)s) is used as custodian which holds the funds of Peer 1 and which has to approve the barter before it can execute.
barter.escrow_as_witness: An escrow (%(escrow)s) is used as a witness which has to approve the barter before it can execute.
barter.escrow_payment_tooltip: Being an escrow requires trust from both peers and should be considered a paid service. The escrow will be paid from Peer 1's account via an additional transfer in the proposal, which increases the overall fee for Peer 1. Set this value to zero to remove it, default value is equal to the transactions fee induced for the escrow.
barter.fee_due_now_tooltip: The indicated transaction fee will be paid when creating this barter proposal to move funds to the escrow
barter.fee_when_proposal_executes_tooltip: When the proposal of this barter executes, the mentioned account will have to pay the indicated transaction fee for the underlying transfer operations
barter.new_barter_tooltip: This panel allows you to create a new barter. It utilizes the atomicity of a transaction to securely swap assets between two accounts (via transfer operations). The transaction is wrapped in a proposal and needs approval from both parties (called Peer 1 and Peer 2 below) to execute, and optionally from an escrow
barter.not_complete: Please fill out all fields to see a description of the action here
barter.proposal_fee_tooltip: The indicated transaction fee will be paid to create the proposal to realize this barter
barter.propose_tooltip: This creates a proposal that needs to be approved by you and all other involved parties. After broadcasting the proposal, go to find the Proposal tab in your Dashboard, approve the proposal and notify the other involved parties.
barter.send_to_escrow: Use escrow as custodian for Peer 1's funds
barter.send_to_escrow_tooltip: Enabling this will send the selected funds to the escrow, and then a barter proposal is created between escrow and Peer 2
barter.title: Barter
barter.total_fees_tooltip: The account that is indicated as Peer 1 will have to pay the indicated transaction fee in total for the whole barter

borrow.borrow_tooltip: You can also find this feature in your Dashboard under the tab Margin Positions, or by clicking  Borrow in the Exchange
borrow.choose: Choose the SmartCoin you want to create a position for
borrow.description: Borrow a BitAsset from the BitShares Blockchain by locking up collateral (e.g. bitUSD, bitCNY, etc.)
borrow.navigate_with_keys: The mechanism of the SmartCoin generation will be explained in the following steps. You can also use arrow keys to navigate
borrow.now_ready: Finalize the creation of your own Collateralized Debt Position

steps_benefits.text: Creating a Collateralized Debt Position allows you to provide liquidity for your desired SmartCoin (MPA), without giving up ownership of your collateral provided that you lock up enough collateral to guarantee the value of the SmartCoin. On the one hand, selling the newly generated SmartCoin on the open market will create leverage on your position (i.e. you sell it short, and will need to buy it back to close the position). On the other hand, holders of the SmartCoin benefit from the significantly less volatile SmartCoin, and they can additionally request a force settlement to obtain the corresponding value in its collateral without the need of markets.
steps_benefits.text_legend:
Forced settlement: Holders of a SmartCoin can request a forced settlement. The SmartCoin is used to forcefully pay back the debt of the least collateralized positions while the former SmartCoin holder receives collateral as if he sold it for the forced settlement price. Any leftover collateral is returned to the position holder. This mechanism enforces a mandated delay after being triggered to avoid abuse (24 hours). 
Forced Settlement Price: The price at which a forced settlement price will occur. It is calculated from the feed price by adding a forced settlement offset to disincentivize forced settlements. All settlements are converted to underlying backing asset (e.g. BTS in the case of bitUSD).
steps_benefits.title: Benefits

steps_concept.text: A Collateralized Debt Position enables every user of the BitShares Blockchain to generate SmartCoins (MPA) by providing collateral. The collateral is locked up until you pay back the SmartCoins you have generated. You are effectively borrowing the SmartCoin from the BitShares Blockchain.
steps_concept.text_legend: Example bitUSD: Provide BTS as collateral to borrow bitUSD
steps_concept.title: Concept
steps_concept.title_within: What is a Collateralized Debt Position?

steps_costs.text: Some longer text Some longer text Some longer text Some longer text Some longer text Some longer text Some longer text Some longer text Some longer text
steps_costs.title: Settlement

steps_introduction.text: Use this native dApp from the BitShares Blockchain to manage depositing collateral and the generation of SmartCoins.
steps_introduction.title_within: This is the place to generate SmartCoins (Market Pegged Assets, MPAs)

steps_risks.text: As long as you monitor your position and make sure that the Collateral Ratio (CR) stays above the Maintenance Collateral Ratio (MCR), your position will not be liquidated. If the value of the collateral drops and your position gets close to MCR, you can lock up more collateral or pay back some of the debt to increase the CR. Failure to remain above MCR results in a forced liquidation of your position (Margin Call). This means that your collateral is automatically sold on the respective market to reduce your debt, with a 10% penalty to ensure the order is filled (penalty is given by the Maximum Short Squeeze Ratio (MSSR)). Any leftover collateral is returned to you after the full debt is paid. You can choose to only allow partial selling of your position by setting the Target Collateral Ratio (TCR). If your position can not be forced to liquidate due to extreme market conditions and the CR drops below the MSSR, the SmartCoin (MPA) automatically enters a state of Global Settlement (GS) and you lose your entire position instantly.
steps_risks.text_legend:
Target Collateral Ratio (TCR): If your position is liquidated, the system automatically puts an order on the market buying back the full debt. If Target Collateral Ratio (TCR) is set, the order will only sell as much debt as needed such that the Collateral Ratio (CR) of your position is the Target Collateral Ratio (TCR). 
 Maximum Short Squeeze Ratio (MSSR): When your position is force liquidated, it is being sold below the current feed price to ensure the order is filled. The MSSR defines how much below feed price. 
 Global Settlement: A globally settled SmartCoin can no longer be generated by opening a Collateralized Debt Position CDP). Instead, SmartCoin holders can settle it instantly for a fixed Global Settlement Price.
steps_risks.title: Risks
steps_risks.title_within: What are the risks involved in borrowing?

steps_setup.text: You decide how much collateral you want to provide and what the collateral ratio (CR) should be. The Maintenance (Minimum) Collateral Ratio (MCR) reflects the lowermost possible value on the scale. You spend the SmartCoin (MPA) as you wish, and when you no longer need the liquidity you buy it back and close the position by paying your debt.
steps_setup.text_legend:
Collateral Ratio (CR): The CR defines how much percent of the generated SmartCoin value is covered by collateral.
Maintenance Collateral ratio (MCR): To guarantee that the SmartCoin has enough backing collateral and to account for volatility, the MCR is enforced when creating the position.
steps_setup.title: Setup

borrow.title: Collaterized Debt Position

direct_debit.description: Setup a direct debit mandate for recurring payments. The mandate allows another account to transfer funds out of your account, with a limit on the amount for defined time intervals.
direct_debit.title: Direct debit

tooltip.authorized_account: The account that is eligible to collect from your account.
tooltip.limit_per_period: The payee may collect a maximum amount of the specified asset (up to) per period. The payee can only collect once per period, even if not collected in full.
tooltip.num_of_periods: After the start time this amount of periods are available consecutively.
tooltip.period: One period lasts the indicated time interval, e.g. 2 weeks.
tooltip.start_time: The start time of the first period must be in the future when broadcasting.

paper_wallet.description: Create a PDF with your account's keys printed (plain text and barcode). If the wallet is unlocked, the private keys are added as well.
paper_wallet.title: Paper Wallet

timed_transfer.description: Initiate a transfer that will execute at a specified time.
timed_transfer.title: Timed transfer

voting.description: Vote on block producers, committee members and worker proposals to influence strategic decisions and advancement of the BitShares Blockchain.
voting.title: Voting

sync_fail.sub_text_1: Please verify that your computer clock is correct.
sync_fail.sub_text_2:
Once you've synchronized your clock, please refresh this page.

If your clock is already correct, the API server you're using could be out of sync. In that case, please try a different server from the list below.
sync_fail.title: Failed to sync with the API server

tooltip.borrow: Borrow %(asset)s from the network. This creates a smart contract that locks your collateral until you either modify the position or a margin call is required.
tooltip.borrow_disabled: %(asset)s is in global settlement. Margin positions can't be created until it is revived. See asset details page for more information
tooltip.bridge: Bridges allow deposit of any external assets and instant trade into the desired gateway asset
tooltip.bridge_TRADE: BlockTrades is a bridge which supports instant trade of assets. Details and terms can be found on https://blocktrades.us
tooltip.buy_min: You will receive at minimum this amount. If there are matching orders with a cheaper price than you specified, you will receive more than this amount.
tooltip.call_limit: This is the call price of the least collateralized margin position in the market.
tooltip.call_price: This is the call price of the position. If the feed price goes below the call price, the position will be margin called.
tooltip.close_position: Click here to close your position. You will need to have at least %(amount)s %(asset)s in order to do so.
tooltip.coll_ratio: The collateral ratio of the position is COLLATERAL * FEED PRICE / DEBT.
tooltip.copy_password: Click here to copy the password to your clipboard
tooltip.copy_tip: Click here to copy the text to your clipboard
tooltip.cr_danger: This position is currently being margin called. Consider adding collateral to bring the collateral ratio above %(mr)s or closing the position.
tooltip.cr_warning: This position has a low level of collateral, and will get margin called if the collateral ratio drops below %(mr)s. Consider adding collateral or closing the position.
tooltip.debug_report: Report an error or unexpected behavior you have found. Click to see the browser console log, create a screenshot and instructions how to best report your issue.
tooltip.deposit_tip: To complete the deposit, go to your external %(asset)s wallet and make a transfer to the address listed on this page. You will receive the deposit as soon as it has been confirmed. If a memo is shown , it is essential that you include this memo in your transfer.
tooltip.disconnected: You are not connected to an API node, try reloading or setting a new access point in the Settings
tooltip.feed_price: This is the current external feed price
tooltip.filter_ops: Use this list to filter your history by operation type.
tooltip.gateway: Gateways provide IOUs on the BitShares Blockchain that are backed by the real asset
tooltip.generate:
The generated password was created by your browser, locally.

No one but you has access to it.

Paste it below and save a copy in a safe place
tooltip.global_settle: This asset is globally settled. Settling it will let you convert your holdings of %(asset)s to %(backingAsset)s instantly, at the global settlement price (visible in exchange header or asset details page).
tooltip.global_settle_price: This is the price at which settle orders will execute. This asset is globally settled, thus settlement orders will execute instantly
tooltip.hide_asset: Click here to hide this asset from this list.
tooltip.lack_funds: There is not enough funds to perform the operation
tooltip.latest_price: This is the latest price seen in this market.
tooltip.legacy_explanation: Hides proposals that are duplicates, spam or have been started but not active for longer than 2 months.
tooltip.login:
This BitShares wallet does not offer a traditional login but instead simply locks or unlocks a wallet that is only stored locally in your browser.

Whenever you close the wallet it will be locked and you will effectively be logged out.
tooltip.login_required: Please login to the selected account to perform this action
tooltip.margin_price: This is the maximum price that a margin called position can be made to pay. It also called the Squeeze Price.
tooltip.market_fee: The owner of %(asset)s charges a market fee of %(percent)s for buy orders. This fee will be subtracted from the amount you receive when your order fills, it is not paid when placing an order.
tooltip.memo_tip: You may include an optional message in the memo field. This allows you to write personal notes and is also often used by exchanges to identify deposits.
tooltip.no_groups_available: No groupings available using this API server
tooltip.no_price: There's no recent price available for this asset that can be used to estimate its value.
tooltip.nodes_popup: Click here to open the access settings popup that allows you to switch nodes if necessary
tooltip.over_limit: The bridge does not have enough of the desired asset for this buy order
tooltip.own_account: You hold keys for this account
tooltip.propose_scam: This proposal was created by a known scammer, do not approve it!
tooltip.propose_tip: Propose another user to initiate a transaction
tooltip.propose_unknown: This proposal was created by or targets an unknown account (not in contacts or whitelist). Beware of scam attempts and carefully check the contained operations.
tooltip.proxy_remove: You have a proxy set, to remove it simply clear this input field
tooltip.proxy_search: Search for an account to be used as your proxy for voting

registration.accountModel: The cloud wallet lets you login to your wallet from anywhere using only your account name and password, but your password is vulnerable to brute-force attacks which means it is important to use a very long password, ideally 20+ characters!
registration.accountName: Account name must contain from 4 to 63 characters and must consist of latin letters, dashes, digits.
registration.password: Password must contain at least 8 characters. It would be better to use a complicated password containing a combination of numbers, special characters and letters.
registration.walletModel: The local wallet has the best security, but is restricted to your current browser and computer. To migrate the wallet to another browser or computer, you may use the backup file or brainkey.
registration.whyBinFile: .bin file - is a backup file. File is encrypted with your password, and contains all the private keys for your accounts. This file must be uploaded during the login process.

tooltip.self_help: Depending on the currently visible panel, this opens a help guide with explanations on what you currently see or the general help section of the wallet
tooltip.settle: Settling will let you convert your holdings of %(asset)s to %(backingAsset)s after a delay of %(settleDelay)s hours, at a price equal to the feed price at that time.
tooltip.settle_price: This is the price at which settle orders will execute.
tooltip.show_asset: Click here to show this asset in the main list.
tooltip.show_block: Click here to show block #%(block)s where this transaction occured.
tooltip.sign_owner: If you are the owner of this account, please check this to make sure the transaction gets signed properly. This is only necessary if you are using the owner account and that account is not included in the active permissions.
tooltip.sync_no: The current node is out of sync with the blockchain, try switching to another one
tooltip.sync_yes: The current node is in sync with the blockchain
tooltip.target_collateral_ratio:
Setting a target collateral ratio can help with not selling all of the posision at once.

Sell as little by setting target below MCR (ex. 1.5)

Sell as little but decrease possible margin calls again by setting it higher than MCR (ex. 3)
tooltip.transfer_actions: Click here to make a transfer, or to deposit/withdraw those assets that support it.
tooltip.unlock_account_name: Click to edit the account name, e.g. when your account is set as permission of another account.
tooltip.update_position: Click here to update your position. You may at any time change the debt and/or collateral levels of your position.
tooltip.withdraw_address: If you don't already have a %(asset)s address, please find a wallet provider and create one in order to complete the withdrawal.
tooltip.withdraw_full: Click to withdraw the full balance

transaction.fund_pool: A financé un pot de frais avec

transfer.broadcast: Votre transfert a bien été diffusé au reseau

errors.balance: Le solde final doit être superieur à 0
errors.memo_error: The transfer memo parsing error, please try again later.
errors.memo_length_error: The transfer memo length exceed, please check
errors.noFeeBalance: Your balance is insufficient to pay fees using this asset, please choose another asset to pay your fees with
errors.noPoolBalance: That asset has an insufficient fee pool balance to pay the fees with. Please inform the asset owner or select another asset for paying fees.

transfer.header_subheader: Transfers are used for sending funds to other BitShares Account Holders
transfer.header_subheader_propose: Propose to send funds from one %(wallet_name)s account to another. The BY account is the account proposing the transaction.
transfer.memo_unlock: Unlock your wallet/account in order to see this memo
transfer.phase_out_warning: We recommend using the new {modal_link} modal as this page will be phased out
transfer.warn_name_unable_read_memo: Proposed sender will be unable to read this memo!

walkthrough.buy_form: Placez les ordres d'achat en utilisant ce formulaire.
walkthrough.buy_orders: Voir toutes les commandes d'achat pour ce marché.
walkthrough.chart_tool_duration: Groupe de données commerciales en utilisant différents intervalles.
walkthrough.chart_tool_indicators: Ajoutez des indicateurs techniques au tableau des prix pour identifier les opportunités de trading.
walkthrough.chart_tool_zoom: Ajustez le graphique des prix pour afficher plus ou moins d'historique des prix.
walkthrough.collapsed_items: View one or several sections of the market by expanding the drawers
walkthrough.create_cloud_wallet: Accédez au portefeuille de cloud en utilisant un nom de compte et un mot de passe.
walkthrough.create_local_wallet: Créez un portefeuille local et téléchargez les clés privées qui lui appartiennent.
walkthrough.depth_chart: Utilisez un tableau de profondeur du marché pour montrer l'offre et la demande à différents prix.
walkthrough.favourite_button: Marquez cette paire comme favorite dans votre liste de marchés.
walkthrough.find_markets_tab: Cet onglet vous permet de rechercher et d'ajouter des marchés supplémentaires à l'onglet Mes marchés.
walkthrough.language_flag: Choisissez parmi 9 langues différentes à utiliser dans le DEX.
walkthrough.my_markets: This tab lists commonly used markets.
walkthrough.panel_hide: You can hide the panel to have more room
walkthrough.personalize: Change the default layout in the personalize settings
walkthrough.price_alerts: Set alerts to get notifications if the price fluctuates
walkthrough.price_chart: Voir l'action des prix d'un actif en utilisant le tableau des prix.
walkthrough.restore_account: Restaurez un portefeuille en utilisant votre fichier de sauvegarde.
walkthrough.sell_form: Placez les ordres de vente en utilisant ce formulaire.
walkthrough.sell_orders: Voir toutes les commandes de vente pour ce marché.
walkthrough.switch_button: Changez les paires de négociation en utilisant ce bouton.

walkthrough.vertical_order: View all orders for this market, including spread and latest order price

wallet.backup_explain: Clicking on the button below will generate a backup file with a .bin extension. This file is encrypted with your wallet password, and contains all the private keys for your accounts. It can be used to restore your wallet, or move it to a different computer/browser.
wallet.backup_new_account: Congratulations, you've just created a new account on the BitShares blockchain! It is strongly recommended that you make a backup of your wallet now. Without a backup there is no way to restore your account if something happens to your computer.
wallet.backup_warning: It appears that your private key files are not backed up. For security reasons we recommend users do not log in without backing up their private keys.
wallet.brainkey_backed_up: This brainkey was last backed up
wallet.brainkey_not_backed_up: This brainkey has never been backed up
wallet.brainkey_reset_success: Sequence reset. In order to regenerate your private keys from the wallet brain key, refresh your browser then unlock the wallet.
wallet.brainkey_seq_reset_text:
Use this to reset the sequence counter used to derive private keys from the wallet brainkey.
It can be used to force a regeneration of private keys from your wallet brain key.
wallet.brainkey_w1: To complete your backup, print this out, or write it down.
wallet.brainkey_w2: Anyone with access to your recovery key will
wallet.brainkey_w3: have access to funds within this local wallet.
wallet.change_backup: Now that you've changed your password, we highly recommend making a new backup.
wallet.claim_later: Once you've imported the keys, you can claim these balances to an account of your choosing.
wallet.confirm_error: The confirmation does not match the password
wallet.create_account_password_text: The keys for this new account will be derived using your password. Nothing is stored in the browser or in a central server, so you will need to ensure you remember this password!!
wallet.create_account_text: The account name you choose needs to be unique, as it will be registered publicly on the blockchain and will be your identifer for any transactions you make.
wallet.create_importkeys_text: In order to import keys, you first need to create a local wallet to contain the keys. Complete the dialog below to create a new local wallet.
wallet.create_password: Create a new account using a password
wallet.create_success: Your local wallet has been created
wallet.create_text: The BitShares local wallet is stored in your browser, it is not stored in the cloud. A wallet can contain multiple accounts and can be easily transferred between browsers and computers using a backup file.
wallet.create_w_a: Create a local wallet containing an account
wallet.delete_confirm_line2: Unexpected bad things will happen if you don’t read this!
wallet.delete_confirm_line3: This action CANNOT be undone, and if you do not have a backup this local wallet will be gone.
wallet.dont_ask_for_backup: Don't ask me to back up again
wallet.first_account_paid: Since this is your first account, a faucet will pay the registration fee for you.
wallet.has_wallet: When you create your first BitShares account, a BitShares local wallet will be automatically created as well and stored in your browser. This local wallet is encrypted with your password, and will contain any private keys belonging to your accounts. It is important that you take the time to backup this wallet once created!
wallet.import_backup_choose: Please select your backup file in the dialog below. This is completely safe as the file is not uploaded anywhere and never leaves your browser.
wallet.import_pass_match: Password matches. Decrypting the backup now...
wallet.local_switch: Local wallet detected matching the given password, switching to local wallet mode
wallet.must_be_ltm: The fee paying account must be a lifetime member to perform that operation.
wallet.name: Local Wallet Name
wallet.need_backup: This local wallet needs a backup
wallet.never_backed_up: This local wallet has never been backed up, you should create a backup now!
wallet.no_wallet: You do not have a local wallet yet?
wallet.not_first_account: Since you already have an account, you will need to pay for this new account yourself. In order to do so, your account needs to have lifetime membership, which can be bought in the account page.
wallet.ok_done: OK, take me to the dashboard
wallet.pass_length: The password must contain at least %(minLength)s characters. Ideally you should use 20 or more, and a combination of numbers, special characters and letters.
wallet.password_crucial: It is crucial that you take the time to write down your password now, whether it be on paper, a password manager, or somewhere else. If you lose or forget this password your account will be lost, we cannot help you get it back.
wallet.password_lose_warning: IMPORTANT: If you forget your pass phrase you will be unable to access your account, we cannot reset or restore your password! Make sure you memorize or write down your password!
wallet.password_model_1: The account model uses a password in combination with your account name to generate your private key on the fly.
wallet.password_model_2: This lets you login to your wallet from anywhere using only your account name and password, but it is vulnerable to brute-force attacks which means it is important to use a very long password!
wallet.paste_private: Paste private keys here (Wallet Import Format - WIF)
wallet.pwd4brainkey: Enter your password to show your brainkey
wallet.remember_me_explanation: Turn 'Remember Me' off to disable remembering your account name and other personal settings.
wallet.tips_explore: Now that you've successfully created an account and downloaded the backup, it's time to get started. Click on one of the links below to start exploring.
wallet.tips_explore_pass: Now that you've successfully created an account and backed up your password, it's time to get started. Click on one of the links on the left to start exploring.
wallet.tips_header: You can also find these same links in the top menu, and in the drop-down menu next to your account name.
wallet.tips_login: IMPORTANT: There is no login/logout functionality here, you merely unlock your wallet when you wish to make a transaction.
wallet.title: Portefeuille
wallet.unclaimed: Unclaimed balances belonging to these keys
wallet.understand_1: I understand that no one can recover my password if I lose or forget it
wallet.understand_2: I have written down or otherwise stored my password
wallet.understand_3: I understand that I will lose access to my funds if I lose my password
wallet.wallet_browser: Your Web Browser is your Wallet
wallet.wallet_crucial: Your local wallet is only stored in your browser, so it is crucial that you create a backup that will enable you to recover your wallet if the data in your browser is lost! No one else can restore your account if you lose your backup.
wallet.wallet_exist: A local wallet called that already exists, please choose a new name
wallet.wallet_exist_with_name: A local wallet called (%(name)s) already exists, please change the name
wallet.wallet_lose_warning: IMPORTANT: If you lose your local wallet or your pass phrase you will be unable to access any of your funds again. Make sure you store the backup somewhere safe, and memorize or write down your password!
wallet.wallet_model_1: The wallet model stores the wallet in your browser. It is encrypted with a password that you choose, and can be backed up using either a brainkey or an encrypted binary file that contains all the private keys.
wallet.wallet_model_2: The wallet model has the best security, but is restricted to your current browser and computer. To migrate the wallet to another browser or computer, you may use the backup file or brainkey.
wallet.wallet_move: This backup file can also be used to move your local wallet to different computers or different browsers. In order to restore your local wallet using this backup you will also need your password!
